If the food tastes terrible, the service is less than desirable and the hygiene of the staff even worse.. if you have to dodge roaches to get to the fork you might want to consider finding another place to eat.
My Grandmother is strange. She goes to the restroom before eating. The cleanliness of the restroom determines whether or not she's going to eat there or not. She used to be a fast food restaurant manager when she was younger. She always said that you could tell almost everything about a place by the way they kept their facilities in order. It's something I tend to do every now and then.. unless I personally know the restaurant is reputable.
Comments
Your grandmother is a smart lady. I've never done that .. but I think it's a great idea.

Mismatched silverware. I know, I know, it's petty. But, if I get a set of silverware with a fork, spoon and knife with different handle designs, it shows that the proprietor of the restaurant does not care about details and isn't trying. And, if there's one thing that I want to know when someone else is cooking my food, it's that they care about details and are interested in making me happy.
